result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin Aiden Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Devin Aiden Long is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Devin Aiden Long was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Devin Aiden Long was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court converts into a civil judgment.

***AMENDED***
Per Judge Howard W. Cameron September 3, 2014 - Defendant may serve St. Croix County Jail time in Barron County Jail if at no expense for St. Croix County.

-Work release granted.
-Consecutive to 1 year serving in Barron County.
-Court reads in and dismisses Barron County Case #14CM229 and  #14CM230.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF Attorney Julie Ann Weber, DF: Devin Aiden Long appeared from jail. Court called at 8:56.  Includes 14CF191 and 14CT96. DE files Plea Questionaire and Waiver of Rights.  There is an agreement.  DE pleads Guilty  to Ct 2 and 3 in case 14CF191.  Crt informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and 3 in case 14CF191. Barron County cases 14CM229 and 14CM230 are read in and dismissed. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 14CF191.  Court dismisses 14CT96. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

14CF191: 
3 mths jail on Ct 2 and 9 mths jail on CT 3 concurrent to each other.  
Consecutive to 1 year serving Barron County. 
Work release granted
77 Days credit
Court costs of $443 for each count.  Court enters civil judgment.  

20 days to appeal.
Plea hearing on July 28, 2014 at 08:45 am.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: S. Fox, ADA:   Michael E Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Julie A Weber   DF:  Devin Aiden Long appeared from jail. Includes 14CF191 and 14CT96. Court reviews prelim waiver. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ARGN: Court reads charges and possible penalties for counts 1, 2 and 3. Def pleads not guilty to all three counts. Bond continues. It is noted that the def is on a PO hold.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 04:15 pm.
Appointing Atty Weber. km

and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $2000.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.


-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Caitlin M. & Pamela W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
